question_text: Why might enterprise systems still favor 3.5-inch drives in hot-swap server bays?
answer_options: They fit better in tablet devices
They offer higher capacity and better compatibility with rack mounts
They have longer MTBF due to flash memory
correct_answer: They offer higher capacity and better compatibility with rack mounts
explanation: 3.5-inch drives provide greater capacity per unit cost and fit standard hot-swap trays in many enterprise server enclosures.
